SEARCH

Class TicTacToe

java.lang.Object
TicTacToe
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, EventListener
public class TicTacToe extends Object implements ActionListener
The TicTacToe class represents the game logic and user interface for a Tic-Tac-Toe game. It manages the game state, player turns, and interaction through the graphical user interface.

  • Constructor Details

    • TicTacToe

      public TicTacToe()
      Constructor for TicTacToe initializes the components and game state. Sets up the main frame, panels for title, buttons, and response controls with their respective functionalities. It configures the frame's default close operation, size, background color, layout, and visibility. Also initializes the game grid and text label with specific styles and fonts.

  • Method Details

    • setRestartB

      public void setRestartB()
      Initializes and configures the "Restart" button and its panel. Sets the layout, background color, bounds, and text of the restart button. Adds action listener to handle the game restart functionality when clicked.

    • setMenuB

      public void setMenuB()
      Initializes and configures the "Menu" button and its panel. Sets the layout, background color, bounds, and text of the menu button. Adds action listener to handle the transition back to the main menu when clicked.

    • displayButtons

      private void displayButtons()
      Makes the control panels visible and refreshes the game frame to update the user interface. This includes making the restart and menu button panels visible, revalidating, and repainting the frame.

    • restartGame

      private void restartGame()
      Restarts the game by disposing of the current frame and creating a new instance of TicTacToe. This method effectively resets the game to its initial state.

    • MainMenu

      private void MainMenu()
      Closes the current game and displays the main menu. This method disposes of the current game frame and initializes the main menu.

    • setupResPanel

      private void setupResPanel()
      Sets up the response panel which contains the restart and menu buttons. Configures the layout, background, and visibility of the panel, and adds it to the south region of the frame.

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
      Responds to button clicks in the TicTacToe grid. When a grid button is clicked and is empty, it triggers a mini-game. After the mini-game, the button is updated based on the result. If the result is 1, an "X" is placed, and if the result is 2, an "O" is placed. It then checks if this move ends the game either by winning or filling up all buttons. If all buttons are filled and there's no winner, it declares a tie.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener
      Parameters:
      e - the ActionEvent that triggered this method, representing a button click

    • displayGameOver

      private void displayGameOver()
      Handles the game over logic, such as disabling all buttons to prevent further interaction and invoking methods to determine if either X or O won. This method ensures no more moves can be made once the game ends.

    • allButtonsFilled

      private boolean allButtonsFilled()
      Checks if all buttons in the TicTacToe grid are filled. This method is used to check for a draw condition when no more moves can be made.
      Returns:
      true if all buttons are filled, false otherwise

    • first

      public void first()
      Determines which player starts the game by randomly setting the first player's turn. Updates the text label to indicate that it is "Ultimate TicTacToe" and whose turn it is to play.

    • checkWin

      public boolean checkWin()
      Checks if either player has won the game by forming a straight line of their marks ('X' or 'O'). The method checks all possible win conditions (horizontal, vertical, and diagonal lines). If a win is detected, it calls either winX() or winO() depending on the winner, and returns true to indicate a player has won.
      Returns:
      true if a player wins, false otherwise

    • winX

      public void winX()
      Handles the game logic for when player X wins. This method updates the text color and text message to indicate that X has won, disables all the buttons to prevent further moves, and displays restart and menu options.

    • winO

      public void winO()
      Handles the game logic for when player O wins. This method updates the text color and text message to indicate that O has won, disables all the buttons to prevent further moves, and displays restart and menu options.
